00093 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094 // Name: CDisplay()
00095 // Desc:
00096 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097 
00098 CDisplay::CDisplay() 
00099         : m_pDD( NULL )
00100     , m_pddsFrontBuffer( NULL )
00101     , m_pddsBackBuffer( NULL )
00102     , m_hWnd( NULL )
00103         , m_bWindowed( true )
00104         , waitForRetrace( false )
00105         , m_lUsedVRAM( 0 )
00106         , m_lPrevUsedVRAM( 0 )
00107 {
00108         m_bFlipping = false;
00109         SetRect( &m_rcWindow, 0, 0, 0, 0 );
00110         SetRect( &m_rcWindowBounds, 0, 0, 0, 0 );
00111 }

00123 HRESULT CDisplay::Restore()
00124 {
00125         HRESULT hr;
00126 
00127         if (!m_pddsFrontBuffer || !m_pddsBackBuffer)
00128                 return DDERR_SURFACELOST;
00129 
00130         if (FAILED ( hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->Restore() ) )
00131                 return hr;
00132 
00133         if (FAILED (hr = m_pddsBackBuffer->Restore() ) )
00134                 return hr;
00135 
00136         return hr;
00137 }
00138 
00139 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140 // Name: DestroyObjects()
00141 // Desc:
00142 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00143 HRESULT CDisplay::DestroyObjects()
00144 {
00145         m_surface.reset((CSurface *)NULL);
00146     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pddsBackBuffer );
00147     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pddsFrontBuffer );
00148         
00149     if( m_pDD )
00150         {
00151                 // Restore if fullscreen mode
00152                 if ( ! m_bWindowed )
00153                         m_pDD->RestoreDisplayMode();
00154 
00155                 // Set cooperative level to normal
00156                 if ( m_hWnd )
00157                 {
00158                         m_pDD->SetCooperativeLevel( m_hWnd, DDSCL_NORMAL | DDSCL_MULTITHREADED );
00159                 }
00160         }
00161 
00162     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pDD );
00163 
00164         return S_OK;
00165 }

00167 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00168 // Name: CreateFullScreenDisplay()
00169 // Desc:
00170 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00171 HRESULT CDisplay::CreateFullScreenDisplay( HWND hWnd, DWORD dwWidth,
00172                                            DWORD dwHeight, DWORD dwBPP )
00173 {
00174     HRESULT hr;
00175 
00176         m_rcWindowBounds = CRect( 0, 0, dwWidth, dwHeight );
00177 
00178     // Cleanup anything from a previous call
00179     DestroyObjects();
00180 
00181         m_surface = shared_ptr<CSurface>(new CSurface);
00182 
00183     // DDraw stuff begins here
00184     if( FAILED( hr = DirectDrawCreateEx( NULL, (VOID**)&m_pDD,
00185                                          IID_IDirectDraw7, NULL ) ) )
00186         {
00187                 assert(0 && _T("DirectDrawCreateEx failed" ) );
00188         return hr;
00189         }
00190 
00191     // Set cooperative level
00192     hr = m_pDD->SetCooperativeLevel( hWnd, DDSCL_EXCLUSIVE | DDSCL_FULLSCREEN | DDSCL_MULTITHREADED);
00193     if( FAILED(hr) )
00194         {
00195                 assert(0 && _T("SetCooperativeLevel failed") );
00196         return hr;
00197         }
00198 
00199     // Set the display mode
00200     hr = m_pDD->SetDisplayMode( dwWidth, dwHeight, dwBPP, 0, 0 );
00201         if ( FAILED( hr ) )
00202         {
00203                 assert (0 && _T("SetDisplayMode failed" ) );
00204         return hr;
00205         }
00206 
00207         // Get amount of vram on machine
00208         DDSCAPS2 ddsCaps;
00209         ZeroMemory(&ddsCaps, sizeof(ddsCaps));
00210         
00211         ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY;
00212         DWORD dwTotal=0;
00213         DWORD dwFree=0;
00214         g_pDisplay->GetDirectDraw()->GetAvailableVidMem(&ddsCaps, &dwTotal, &dwFree); 
00215         
00216 #ifndef DIRTY_RECTS
00217         // If we have a really nice machine (something with more vram than your average toaster)
00218         // use double buffering and flipping, otherwise just use an offscreen surface in system ram
00219         // to help us save that extra vram that our game needs for cards, icons, etc...
00220         if ( dwFree >= 4 * MEGABYTE && gp_GraphicalApp->m_usePageFlipping )
00221         {
00222                 // Create primary surface (with backbuffer attached)
00223                 DDSURFACEDESC2 ddsd;
00224                 ZeroMemory( &ddsd, sizeof( ddsd ) );
00225                 ddsd.dwSize            = sizeof( ddsd );
00226                 ddsd.dwFlags           = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_BACKBUFFERCOUNT;
00227                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps    = DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE | DDSCAPS_FLIP |
00228                                                                  DDSCAPS_COMPLEX;
00229                 ddsd.dwBackBufferCount = 1;
00230 
00231                 if( FAILED( hr = /*m_pDD->*/CreateSurface( &ddsd, &m_pddsFrontBuffer,
00232                                                                                            NULL ) ) )
00233                 {
00234                         assert( 0 && _T("CreateSurface failed (%s)" ) );
00235                         return hr;
00236                 }
00237 
00238                 //Set pixel format
00239                 m_pddsFrontBuffer->GetSurfaceDesc(&ddsd);
00240                 m_pixelFormat = GetPixelFormat();
00241 
00242                 // Get a pointer to the back buffer
00243                 DDSCAPS2 ddscaps;
00244                 ZeroMemory( &ddscaps, sizeof( ddscaps ) );
00245                 ddscaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_BACKBUFFER;
00246 
00247                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->GetAttachedSurface( &ddscaps,
00248                                                                                                                                 &m_pddsBackBuffer ) ) )
00249                 {
00250                         assert( 0 && _T("GetAttachedSurface failed" );
00251                         return hr;
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 // Set flipping flag
00255                 m_bFlipping = true;
00256         }
00257         else
00258 #endif
00259         {
00260                 // Create primary surface
00261                 DDSURFACEDESC2 ddsd;
00262                 ZeroMemory( &ddsd, sizeof( ddsd ) );
00263                 ddsd.dwSize            = sizeof( ddsd );
00264                 ddsd.dwFlags           = DDSD_CAPS;
00265                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps    = DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE;
00266                 
00267                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pDD->CreateSurface( &ddsd, &m_pddsFrontBuffer, NULL ) ) )
00268                 {
00269                         assert( 0 && _T("CreateSurface failed" ) );
00270                         return hr;
00271                 }
00272 
00273                 //Set pixel format
00274                 m_pddsFrontBuffer->GetSurfaceDesc(&ddsd);
00275                 m_pixelFormat = GetPixelFormat();
00276 
00277                 // Create the backbuffer surface
00278                 ddsd.dwFlags        = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_HEIGHT;    
00279                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;// | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
00280                 ddsd.dwWidth        = dwWidth;
00281                 ddsd.dwHeight       = dwHeight;
00282                 
00283                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pDD->CreateSurface( &ddsd, &m_pddsBackBuffer, NULL ) ) )
00284                 {
00285                         assert ( 0 && _T("CreateSurface failed" ) );
00286                         return hr;
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 // Set flipping flag
00290                 m_bFlipping = false;
00291         }
00292 
00293     // Update bounds
00294         m_hWnd      = hWnd;
00295     m_bWindowed = FALSE;
00296     UpdateBounds();
00297 
00298         // Create a clipper so DirectDraw will not blt over the GDI dialog
00299         if( FAILED( hr = g_pDisplay->InitClipper() ) )
00300         {
00301                 assert( 0 && _T("InitClipper failed" ) );
00302                 return hr;
00303         }
00304 
00305         // Create background CSurface
00306         if( FAILED( hr = m_surface->Create(m_pddsBackBuffer) ) )
00307         {
00308                 assert( 0 && _T("m_surface->Create failed (%s)\n" ) );
00309                 return hr;
00310         }
00311 
00312         // Clear all surfaces
00313         DDBLTFX ddbltfx;
00314         ZeroMemory(&ddbltfx, sizeof(ddbltfx));
00315     ddbltfx.dwSize = sizeof(ddbltfx);
00316     ddbltfx.dwFillColor = COLOR_BLACK;
00317 
00318         if ( m_pddsFrontBuffer )
00319         {
00320                 hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->Blt(NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00321                 if ( FAILED( hr ) ) 
00322                         return hr;
00323         }
00324 
00325         if ( m_pddsBackBuffer )
00326         {
00327                 hr = m_pddsBackBuffer->Blt(NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00328                 if ( FAILED( hr ) ) 
00329                         return hr;
00330         }
00331 
00332         Present( ); // Overwrite possible garbage frame buffer contents from SetDisplayMode()
00333 
00334         return hr;
00335 }

00337 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00338 // Name: CreateWindowedDisplay()
00339 // Desc:
00340 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00341 HRESULT CDisplay::CreateWindowedDisplay( HWND hWnd, DWORD dwWidth, DWORD dwHeight )
00342 {
00343     HRESULT hr;
00344 
00345         m_rcWindowBounds = CRect( 0, 0, dwWidth, dwHeight );
00346 
00347         // Cleanup anything from a previous call
00348     DestroyObjects();
00349 
00350         m_surface = shared_ptr<CSurface>(new CSurface);
00351 
00352     // DDraw stuff begins here
00353     if( FAILED( hr = DirectDrawCreateEx( NULL, (VOID**)&m_pDD,
00354                                          IID_IDirectDraw7, NULL ) ) )
00355         {
00356                 assert(0 && _T("DirectDrawCreateEx failed" ) );
00357         return hr;
00358         }
00359 
00360     // Set cooperative level
00361     hr = m_pDD->SetCooperativeLevel( hWnd, DDSCL_NORMAL | DDSCL_MULTITHREADED );
00362     if( FAILED(hr) )
00363         {
00364                 assert(0 && _T("SetCooperativeLevel failed") );
00365         return hr;
00366         }
00367 
00368     // Create the primary surface
00369     DDSURFACEDESC2 ddsd;
00370     ZeroMemory( &ddsd, sizeof( ddsd ) );
00371     ddsd.dwSize         = sizeof( ddsd );
00372     ddsd.dwFlags        = DDSD_CAPS;
00373     ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE;
00374 
00375     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDD->CreateSurface( &ddsd, &m_pddsFrontBuffer, NULL ) ) )
00376         {
00377                 assert( 0 && _T("CreateSurface failed (%s)" ) );
00378         return hr;
00379         }
00380 
00381         //Set pixel format
00382         m_pddsFrontBuffer->GetSurfaceDesc(&ddsd);
00383         m_pixelFormat = GetPixelFormat();
00384         
00385         //m_pddsFrontBuffer->AddRef(); Whoops! This was in the book. It's a mistake.
00386 
00387     // Create the backbuffer surface
00388     ddsd.dwFlags        = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_HEIGHT;    
00389     ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;// | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
00390     ddsd.dwWidth        = dwWidth;
00391     ddsd.dwHeight       = dwHeight;
00392 
00393     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDD->CreateSurface( &ddsd, &m_pddsBackBuffer, NULL ) ) )
00394         {
00395                 assert( 0 && _T("CreateSurface failed (%s)" ) );
00396         return hr;
00397         }
00398 
00399         // Setup
00400         m_hWnd      = hWnd;
00401     m_bWindowed = TRUE;
00402     UpdateBounds();
00403 
00404         // Create a clipper so DirectDraw will not blt over the GDI dialog
00405         if( FAILED( hr = g_pDisplay->InitClipper() ) )
00406         {
00407                 assert( 0 && _T("InitClipper failed" ) );
00408                 return hr;
00409         }
00410     
00411         // Set flipping flag
00412         m_bFlipping = false;
00413         
00414     hr = m_surface->Create(m_pddsBackBuffer);
00415         if ( FAILED( hr ) )
00416         {
00417                 assert( 0 && _T("m_surface->Create failed (%s)\n" ) );
00418                 return hr;
00419         }
00420 
00421         // Clear all surfaces
00422         DDBLTFX ddbltfx;
00423         ZeroMemory(&ddbltfx, sizeof(ddbltfx));
00424     ddbltfx.dwSize = sizeof(ddbltfx);
00425     ddbltfx.dwFillColor = COLOR_BLACK;
00426 
00427         if ( m_pddsFrontBuffer )
00428         {
00429                 hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->Blt(NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00430                 if ( FAILED( hr ) ) 
00431                         return hr;
00432         }
00433 
00434         if ( m_pddsBackBuffer )
00435         {
00436                 hr = m_pddsBackBuffer->Blt(NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00437                 if ( FAILED( hr ) ) 
00438                         return hr;
00439         }
00440 
00441         return S_OK;
00442 }

00444 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00445 // Name: SetClipperWindow( HWND hwnd )
00446 // Desc: Binds the rendering to only this window
00447 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00448 HRESULT CDisplay::SetClipperWindow( HWND hwnd )
00449 {
00450         LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER clipper;
00451 
00452         HRESULT hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->GetClipper( & clipper );
00453         if ( FAILED( hr ) )
00454                 return hr;
00455         
00456         clipper->SetHWnd( 0, hwnd );
00457         
00458         return hr;
00459 }
00460 
00461 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00462 // Name: CDisplay::CreateSurface
00463 // Desc: Creates a DirectX7 surface given width, height, and surface caps
00464 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00465 HRESULT CDisplay::CreateSurface( shared_ptr<CSurface> &pSurface,
00466                                  DWORD dwWidth, DWORD dwHeight, DWORD dwCaps )
00467 {
00468     if( NULL == m_pDD )
00469         return E_POINTER;
00470     if( NULL == pSurface.get() )
00471         return E_INVALIDARG;
00472 
00473     HRESULT        hr;
00474     DDSURFACEDESC2 ddsd;
00475     ZeroMemory( &ddsd, sizeof( ddsd ) );
00476     ddsd.dwSize         = sizeof( ddsd );
00477     ddsd.dwFlags        = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_HEIGHT; 
00478 
00479         if (m_favorVRAM && dwHeight<=(unsigned int)m_surface->GetHeight() && dwWidth<=(unsigned int)m_surface->GetWidth() )
00480         {
00481                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY;
00482         }
00483         else
00484         {
00485                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY | DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;
00486         }
00487 
00488         ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps |= dwCaps;
00489 
00490     ddsd.dwWidth        = dwWidth;
00491     ddsd.dwHeight               = dwHeight;
00492         
00493         // Set the pixel format?
00494         //ddsd.ddpfPixelFormat = rgbBitCount = SCREEN_BPP;
00495 
00496         pSurface = shared_ptr<CSurface>(new CSurface);
00497 
00498     if( FAILED( hr = pSurface->Create( m_pDD, &ddsd ) ) )
00499     {
00500                 ddsd.ddsCaps.dwCaps = dwCaps | DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
00501             if( FAILED( hr = pSurface->Create( m_pDD, &ddsd ) ) )
00502                 {
00503                     pSurface.reset((CSurface *)NULL);
00504                     return hr;
00505                 }
00506     }
00507 
00508     return S_OK;
00509 }
00510 
00511 
00512 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00513 // Name: CDisplay::CreateSurfaceFromBitmap()
00514 // Desc: Creates a DirectDrawSurface from a pac file given the folder and id
00515 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00516 HRESULT CDisplay::CreateSurfaceFromBitmap( shared_ptr<CSurface> &surface, const char *pBitmapData )
00517 {
00518     surface.reset((CSurface *)NULL);
00519 
00520         int width;
00521         int height;
00522         int bpp;
00523 
00524         HRESULT hRet;
00525 
00526         // Get bitmap info
00527         Bitmap::GetBitmapInfo( pBitmapData, width, height, bpp );
00528 
00529         try
00530         {
00531                 // Create the surface
00532                 surface = shared_ptr<CSurface>(new CSurface);
00533 
00534                 if ( FAILED( hRet = CreateSurface( surface, width, height ) ) )
00535                 {
00536                         throw _T("Create Surface failed.");
00537                 }
00538 
00539                 // Lock
00540                 if ( FAILED( hRet = (surface->Lock( &surface->m_ddsd ) ) ) )
00541                 {
00542                         // blahhh.
00543                         throw _T("Failed to lock surface for load" );
00544                 }
00545         
00546                 // Fill the surface
00547                 if ( ! Bitmap::FillSurfaceFromBitmap( pBitmapData, &surface->m_ddsd, NULL ) )
00548                 {
00549                         hRet = E_FAIL;
00550                         throw _T("Failed to fill surface from bitmap" );
00551                 }
00552 
00553                 surface->Unlock();
00554         }
00555 
00556         catch(TCHAR *msg)
00557         {
00558                 assert(0 && msg);
00559                 return E_FAIL;
00560         }
00561 
00562         return S_OK;
00563 }
00564 
00565 
00566 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00567 // Name: CDisplay::FlipToGDISurface()
00568 // Desc: Flip to the GDI if necessary
00569 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00570 
00571 HRESULT CDisplay::FlipToGDISurface( bool force )
00572 {
00573         HRESULT hr = DD_OK;
00574         
00575         if ( m_pDD )
00576         {
00577                 if ( ! m_bWindowed )
00578                 {
00579                         // ET - 05/24/01 - Bug #1994
00580                         // Don't allow flipping to system w/o flipping surface
00581                         // This only happens on min. config machines as they
00582                         // are setup w/o flipping.
00583                         if ( ( force || m_iNumModals > 0 ) && m_bFlipping )
00584                                 hr = m_pDD->FlipToGDISurface();
00585                         
00586                         if ( FAILED( hr ) )
00587                                 assert( 0 && _T("FlipToGDI() failed" ) );
00588                 }
00589         }
00590         return hr;
00591 }       
00592 
00593 
00594 unsigned long CDisplay::GetUsedVRAM()
00595 {
00596         // Initialize the structure.
00597         DDSCAPS2 ddsCaps;
00598         ZeroMemory(&ddsCaps, sizeof(ddsCaps));
00599         
00600         ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY;
00601         DWORD dwTotal=0;
00602         DWORD dwFree=0;
00603         
00604         HRESULT hr = GetDirectDraw()->GetAvailableVidMem(&ddsCaps, &dwTotal, &dwFree); 
00605         
00606         m_lPrevUsedVRAM = m_lUsedVRAM;
00607         m_lUsedVRAM = dwTotal-dwFree;
00608         
00609         //EString tmp;
00610         //tmp.Format( _T("VRAM increased > 1M since last poll (%ld to %ld) (%s)!\n"), m_lPrevUsedVRAM, m_lUsedVRAM );
00611         
00612         return m_lUsedVRAM;
00613 }
00614 
00615 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00616 // Name: GetPixelFormat()
00617 // Desc: Gets the pixel format from the surface
00618 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00619 PixelFormat CDisplay::GetPixelFormat( LPDDPIXELFORMAT ddpixelformat )
00620 {
00621         // Save the pixel format
00622         switch( ddpixelformat->dwRGBBitCount )
00623         {
00624         case 16 : 
00625                 // 16 bit - 555 or 565
00626                 if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0x7c00 &&  // 555 RGB
00627                          ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x03e0 && 
00628                          ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x1f )
00629                 {
00630                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_555;
00631                 }
00632                 else if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0xf800 && 
00633                         ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x07e0 && 
00634                         ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x1f ) // 565 RGB
00635                 {
00636                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_565;
00637                 }
00638                 
00639                 //default
00640                 return PIXELFORMAT_16;
00641   
00642         case 32 : 
00643                 
00644                 // 32 bit - 888
00645                 if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0xff0000 &&  // 888 RGB
00646                         ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x00ff00 && 
00647                         ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x0000ff )
00648                 {
00649                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_32;
00650                 }
00651                 
00652                 // default
00653                 return PIXELFORMAT_32; 
00654   
00655         default : 
00656                 assert( 0 && "Invalid pixel format for surface (8,16,32 bit only)\n" );
00657                 break;
00658         }
00659   
00660         return PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN;
00661 }

00668 
00669 //=========================================================
00670 // CDisplay::Present
00671 //
00672 // Blits the final frame to the frontbuffer
00673 //
00674 // Game Code Complete reference - Chapter 7, page 232-233
00675 //=========================================================
00676 
00677 HRESULT CDisplay::Present( )
00678 {
00679     HRESULT hr = S_OK;
00680         
00681     if( NULL == m_pddsFrontBuffer && NULL == m_pddsBackBuffer )
00682         return E_POINTER;
00683 
00684     while( 1 )
00685     {
00686                 // Windowed mode - nothing special - full or partial BLIT to frontbuffer
00687                 if ( m_bWindowed || ! m_bFlipping )
00688                 {
00689                         // Set vertical blank wait if modals are up
00690                         if ( waitForRetrace || m_iNumModals > 0 )
00691                                 m_pDD->WaitForVerticalBlank(DDWAITVB_BLOCKBEGIN, NULL);
00692 
00693                         UpdateBounds();
00694 
00695                         hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->Blt( 
00696                                 &m_rcWindow, 
00697                                 m_pddsBackBuffer,
00698                                 NULL,
00699                                 DDBLT_WAIT,
00700                                 NULL );
00701                 }
00702                 else
00703                 {
00704                         // Fullscreen FLIP
00705                         hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->Flip( NULL, 0 );
00706                 }
00707 
00708                 //if ( FAILED( hr ) )
00709                 //      TRACE(0 && _T("Present() failed to FLIP/BLIT m_surface" ) );
00710                 
00711         if( hr == DDERR_SURFACELOST )
00712         {
00713                         if (FAILED (hr = Restore() ) )
00714                         {
00715                                 return hr;
00716                         }
00717         }
00718                 else if( hr != DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING )
00719                 {
00720             return hr;
00721                 }
00722         }
00723 
00724 
00725         return hr;
00726 }
00727 
00728 
00729 
00730 
00731 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00732 // Name: 
00733 // Desc: 
00734 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00735 HRESULT CDisplay::ColorKeyBlt( DWORD x, DWORD y, LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 pdds,
00736                                RECT* prc )
00737 {
00738     if( NULL == m_pddsBackBuffer )
00739         return E_POINTER;
00740 
00741         return m_pddsBackBuffer->BltFast( x, y, pdds, prc, DDBLTFAST_SRCCOLORKEY );
00742 }
00743 
00744 
00745 
00746 
00747 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00748 // Name: 
00749 // Desc: 
00750 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00751 HRESULT CDisplay::Blt( DWORD x, DWORD y, LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 pdds, RECT* prc,
00752                        DWORD dwFlags )
00753 {
00754     HRESULT hr = DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING;
00755 
00756         if( NULL == m_pddsBackBuffer )
00757         return E_POINTER;
00758 
00759         while ( hr == DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING )
00760         {
00761                 hr = m_pddsBackBuffer->BltFast( x, y, pdds, prc, dwFlags );
00762         }
00763 
00764     return hr;
00765 }
00766 
00767 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00768 // Name: 
00769 // Desc: 
00770 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00771 //bool trumpHackToGetBlitToNotScrewUpWhenRectPassedInEqualsNull = false;
00772 
00773 HRESULT CDisplay::Blt( DWORD x, DWORD y, CSurface* pSurface, RECT* prc, DWORD dwFlags )
00774 {
00775     if( NULL == pSurface )
00776         return E_INVALIDARG;
00777 
00778     HRESULT hr = DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING;
00779 
00780         while ( hr == DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING )
00781         {
00782                 if( pSurface->IsColorKeyed() )
00783                 {
00784                         hr = Blt( x, y, pSurface->GetDDrawSurface(), prc, DDBLTFAST_SRCCOLORKEY | dwFlags);
00785                 }
00786                 else
00787                 {
00788                         hr = Blt( x, y, pSurface->GetDDrawSurface(), prc, dwFlags );
00789                 }
00790         }
00791 
00792     return hr;
00793 }
00794 
00795 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00796 // Name: 
00797 // Desc: 
00798 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00799 HRESULT CDisplay::Clear( DWORD dwColor )
00800 {
00801     if( NULL == m_pddsBackBuffer || NULL == m_surface.get() )
00802         return E_POINTER;
00803 
00804         return m_surface->Fill(optional_empty(), dwColor);
00805 }
00806 
00807 
00808 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00809 // Name: 
00810 // Desc: 
00811 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00812 HRESULT CDisplay::UpdateBounds()
00813 {
00814     if( m_bWindowed && m_hWnd )
00815     {
00816         GetClientRect( m_hWnd, &m_rcWindow );
00817         ClientToScreen( m_hWnd, (POINT*)&m_rcWindow );
00818         ClientToScreen( m_hWnd, (POINT*)&m_rcWindow+1 );
00819     }
00820     else
00821     {
00822         SetRect( &m_rcWindow, 0, 0, GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXSCREEN),
00823                  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYSCREEN) );
00824     }
00825 
00826     return S_OK;
00827 }
00828 
00829 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00830 // Name: CDisplay::InitClipper
00831 // Desc: 
00832 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00833 HRESULT CDisplay::InitClipper()
00834 {
00835     LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER pClipper;
00836     HRESULT hr;
00837 
00838     // Create a clipper when using GDI to draw on the primary surface 
00839     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDD->CreateClipper( 0, &pClipper, NULL ) ) )
00840         return hr;
00841 
00842     pClipper->SetHWnd( 0, m_hWnd );
00843 
00844     if( FAILED( hr = m_pddsFrontBuffer->SetClipper( pClipper ) ) )
00845         return hr;
00846 
00847     // We can release the clipper now since m_pddsFrontBuffer 
00848     // now maintains a ref count on the clipper
00849     SAFE_RELEASE( pClipper );
00850 
00851     return S_OK;
00852 }
00853 
00854 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00855 // Name: 
00856 // Desc: 
00857 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00858 void CDisplay::WaitForRetrace(bool nwaitForRetrace)
00859 {
00860         waitForRetrace = nwaitForRetrace;
00861 }

00870         , m_bColorKeyed( NULL )
00871 {
00872 }

00877 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00878 CSurface::~CSurface()
00879 {
00880     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pdds );
00881 }
00882 
00883 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00884 // Name: 
00885 // Desc: 
00886 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00887 HRESULT CSurface::Create( LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE7 pdds )
00888 {
00889         HRESULT hr = S_OK;
00890     m_pdds = pdds;
00891 
00892     if( m_pdds )
00893     {
00894         m_pdds->AddRef();
00895 
00896         // Get the DDSURFACEDESC structure for this surface
00897         m_ddsd.dwSize = sizeof(m_ddsd);
00898         m_pdds->GetSurfaceDesc( &m_ddsd );
00899     }
00900 
00901     return hr;
00902 }
00903 
00904 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00905 // Name: 
00906 // Desc: 
00907 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00908 HRESULT CSurface::Create( LPDIRECTDRAW7 pDD, DDSURFACEDESC2* pddsd )
00909 {
00910     HRESULT hr;
00911 
00912     // Create the DDraw surface
00913     if( FAILED( hr = pDD->CreateSurface( pddsd, &m_pdds, NULL ) ) )
00914         return hr;
00915 
00916     // Prepare the DDSURFACEDESC structure
00917     m_ddsd.dwSize = sizeof(m_ddsd);
00918 
00919     // Get the DDSURFACEDESC structure for this surface
00920     m_pdds->GetSurfaceDesc( &m_ddsd );
00921 
00922     return hr;
00923 }
00924 
00925 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00926 // Name: 
00927 // Desc: 
00928 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00929 HRESULT CSurface::Destroy()
00930 {
00931     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pdds );
00932     return S_OK;
00933 }

00935 
00936 
00937 HRESULT CSurface::Fill( const optional<CRect> r, DWORD dwColor )
00938 {
00939         DDBLTFX ddbltfx;
00940 
00941         DWORD c( ConvertGDIColor( dwColor ) );
00942 
00943     ZeroMemory(&ddbltfx, sizeof(ddbltfx));
00944     ddbltfx.dwSize = sizeof(ddbltfx);
00945     ddbltfx.dwFillColor = c;
00946   
00947         HRESULT hr;
00948         if ( r.valid() )
00949                 hr = m_pdds->Blt( (LPRECT)&(*r), NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00950         else
00951         hr = m_pdds->Blt( NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
00952 
00953         return hr;
00954 }
00955 
00956 
00957 HRESULT CSurface::Line(const CPoint &p1, const CPoint &p2, DWORD color, const int penWidth)
00958 {
00959         HDC hdc;
00960         HRESULT hr;
00961 
00962         hr = m_pdds->GetDC(&hdc);
00963         if ( hr != DD_OK )
00964                 return hr;
00965 
00966         int m_nPenWidth   = penWidth;   //1;
00967         HPEN m_hPen = ::CreatePen(PS_SOLID, m_nPenWidth, color);
00968 
00969         HPEN hPenPrevious = NULL;
00970         if (m_hPen != NULL)
00971                 hPenPrevious = (HPEN)::SelectObject(hdc, (HGDIOBJ)m_hPen);
00972 
00973         ::MoveToEx(hdc, p1.x, p1.y, NULL);
00974         ::LineTo(hdc, p2.x, p2.y);
00975 
00976         if (hPenPrevious != NULL)
00977                 ::SelectObject(hdc, (HGDIOBJ)hPenPrevious);
00978 
00979         hr = m_pdds->ReleaseDC(hdc);
00980         ::DeleteObject(m_hPen);
00981 
00982         return hr;
00983 }
00984 
00985 HRESULT CSurface::Box(const CRect &rect, const int thickness, DWORD color)
00986 {
00987         HDC hdc;
00988         HRESULT hr;
00989         hr = m_pdds->GetDC(&hdc);
00990         if ( hr != DD_OK )
00991                 return hr;
00992 
00993         int m_nPenWidth   = thickness;
00994         HPEN m_hPen = ::CreatePen(PS_SOLID, m_nPenWidth, color);
00995 
00996         HPEN hPenPrevious = NULL;
00997         if (m_hPen != NULL)
00998                 hPenPrevious = (HPEN)::SelectObject(hdc, (HGDIOBJ)m_hPen);
00999 
01000         // The LineTo does not include the last point, but the next
01001         // LineTo() call will start and drop at the previous ending point.
01002         ::MoveToEx(hdc, rect.left, rect.top, NULL);
01003         ::LineTo(hdc, rect.left, rect.bottom);
01004         ::LineTo(hdc, rect.right, rect.bottom);
01005         ::LineTo(hdc, rect.right, rect.top);
01006         ::LineTo(hdc, rect.left, rect.top);
01007 
01008         if (hPenPrevious != NULL)
01009                 ::SelectObject(hdc, (HGDIOBJ)hPenPrevious);
01010 
01011         hr = m_pdds->ReleaseDC(hdc);
01012         ::DeleteObject(m_hPen);
01013 
01014         return hr;
01015 }
01016 
01017 HRESULT CSurface::GetDC( HDC* hdc )
01018 {
01019         if ( ! m_pdds )
01020                 return DDERR_SURFACELOST;
01021         
01022         return m_pdds->GetDC( hdc );
01023 }
01024 
01025 HRESULT CSurface::ReleaseDC( HDC hdc )
01026 {
01027         if ( ! m_pdds )
01028                 return DDERR_SURFACELOST;
01029 
01030         return m_pdds->ReleaseDC( hdc );
01031 }

01033 
01034 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01035 // Name: 
01036 // Desc: 
01037 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01038 HRESULT CSurface::SetColorKey( DWORD dwColorKey )
01039 {
01040     if( NULL == m_pdds )
01041         return E_POINTER;
01042 
01043     m_bColorKeyed = TRUE;
01044 
01045         // #1763 - record color key in a local for later use in creating textures
01046     m_ddck.dwColorSpaceLowValue  = ConvertGDIColor( dwColorKey );
01047     m_ddck.dwColorSpaceHighValue = ConvertGDIColor( dwColorKey );
01048     
01049     return m_pdds->SetColorKey( DDCKEY_SRCBLT, &m_ddck );
01050         // End #1763
01051 }
01052 
01053 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01054 // Name: CSurface::ConvertGDIColor()
01055 // Desc: Converts a GDI color (0x00bbggrr) into the equivalent color on a 
01056 //       DirectDrawSurface using its pixel format.  
01057 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01058 DWORD CSurface::ConvertGDIColor( COLORREF dwGDIColor )
01059 {
01060     if( m_pdds == NULL )
01061             return 0x00000000;
01062 
01063     COLORREF       rgbT = 0;
01064     HDC            hdc;
01065     DWORD          dw = CLR_INVALID;
01066     DDSURFACEDESC2 ddsd;
01067     HRESULT        hr;
01068 
01069         //  Use GDI SetPixel to color match for us
01070     if( dwGDIColor != CLR_INVALID && m_pdds->GetDC(&hdc) == DD_OK)
01071     {
01072         rgbT = GetPixel(hdc, 0, 0);     // Save current pixel value
01073         SetPixel(hdc, 0, 0, dwGDIColor);       // Set our value
01074         m_pdds->ReleaseDC(hdc);
01075     }
01076 
01077     // Now lock the surface so we can read back the converted color
01078     ddsd.dwSize = sizeof(ddsd);
01079     hr = m_pdds->Lock( NULL, &ddsd, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
01080     if( hr == DD_OK)
01081     {
01082                 dw = *(DWORD *) ddsd.lpSurface;
01083         if( ddsd.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount < 32 ) // Mask it to bpp
01084                         dw &= ( 1 << ddsd.ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount ) - 1;  
01085         m_pdds->Unlock(NULL);
01086     }
01087 
01088     //  Now put the color that was there back.
01089     if( dwGDIColor != CLR_INVALID && m_pdds->GetDC(&hdc) == DD_OK )
01090     {
01091         SetPixel( hdc, 0, 0, rgbT );
01092         m_pdds->ReleaseDC(hdc);
01093     }
01094     
01095     return dw;    
01096 }
01097 
01098 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01099 // Name: CSurface::Lock(DDSURFACEDESC2* pddsd)
01100 // Desc: Locks the entire surface for explicit drawing
01101 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01102 HRESULT CSurface::Lock(DDSURFACEDESC2* pddsd) const
01103 {
01104     // Now lock the surface
01105     return Lock( NULL, pddsd );
01106 }
01107 
01108 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01109 // Name: CSurface::Lock(DDSURFACEDESC2* pddsd)
01110 // Desc: Locks the entire surface for explicit drawing
01111 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01112 HRESULT CSurface::Lock(LPRECT rect, DDSURFACEDESC2* pddsd) const
01113 {
01114     if( m_pdds == NULL )
01115                 return 0x00000000;
01116         
01117     // Now lock the surface
01118     return m_pdds->Lock( rect, pddsd, DDLOCK_WAIT, NULL );
01119 }
01120 
01121 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01122 // Name: CSurface::Unlock()
01123 // Desc: Unlocks the surface
01124 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01125 HRESULT CSurface::Unlock() const
01126 {
01127     if( m_pdds == NULL )
01128                 return 0x00000000;
01129 
01130         return m_pdds->Unlock(NULL);
01131 }
01132 
01133 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01134 // Name: CSurface::GetBitMaskInfo()
01135 // Desc: Returns the number of bits and the shift in the bit mask
01136 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01137 HRESULT CSurface::GetBitMaskInfo( DWORD dwBitMask, DWORD* pdwShift, DWORD* pdwBits )
01138 {
01139     DWORD dwShift = 0;
01140     DWORD dwBits  = 0; 
01141 
01142     if( pdwShift == NULL || pdwBits == NULL )
01143         return E_INVALIDARG;
01144 
01145     if( dwBitMask )
01146     {
01147         while( (dwBitMask & 1) == 0 )
01148         {
01149             dwShift++;
01150             dwBitMask >>= 1;
01151         }
01152     }
01153 
01154     while( (dwBitMask & 1) != 0 )
01155     {
01156         dwBits++;
01157         dwBitMask >>= 1;
01158     }
01159 
01160     *pdwShift = dwShift;
01161     *pdwBits  = dwBits;
01162 
01163     return S_OK;
01164 }
01165 
01166 
01167 HRESULT CSurface::IsLost() const
01168 {
01169         if ( m_pdds )
01170                 return m_pdds->IsLost();
01171 
01172         return DDERR_SURFACELOST;
01173 }
01174 
01175 
01176 HRESULT CSurface::Restore()
01177 {
01178         HRESULT hr;
01179 
01180         if ( m_pdds )
01181         {
01182                 if (FAILED(hr = m_pdds->Restore() ) )
01183                         return hr;
01184         }
01185 
01186         return DD_OK;
01187 }
01188 
01189 HRESULT CSurface::Clear()
01190 {
01191         DDBLTFX ddbltfx;
01192 
01193         assert( IsColorKeyed() && "This is not colorkeyed... Either set the colorkey or use fill instead" );
01194 
01195         DWORD c( GetColorKey().dwColorSpaceLowValue );
01196 
01197     ZeroMemory(&ddbltfx, sizeof(ddbltfx));
01198         ddbltfx.dwSize = sizeof(ddbltfx);
01199     ddbltfx.dwFillColor = c;
01200   
01201         HRESULT hr = m_pdds->Blt( NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL | DDBLT_WAIT, &ddbltfx);
01202 
01203         return hr;
01204 }
01205 
01206 
01207 // Utility function to make sure the correct area
01208 void Clip( 
01209         const CRect& destRect
01210         , CPoint* destPoint
01211         , const CPoint& srcSize
01212         , CRect* srcRect )
01213 {
01214         // Check the size of the source rectangle.
01215         // If it's too large (compare against srcSize)
01216         // then it needs to be clipped... someone
01217         // passed in data that wasn't quite right.
01218         CRect srcClipped( *srcRect );
01219 
01220         // Compare the dimesions of the rectangle
01221         // and modify them if they fall out of the bounds
01222         CRect rcSrcOutOfBounds( 0, 0, srcSize.x, srcSize.y );
01223         srcClipped.IntersectRect( rcSrcOutOfBounds, srcClipped );
01224 
01225         // This is the amount that is clipped off the source
01226         CPoint sOffset( srcRect->left - srcClipped.left, srcRect->top - srcClipped.top );
01227         
01228     // Take the new rectangle
01229         // and put it over the destination location
01230         CPoint origLoc( srcClipped.TopLeft() );
01231         srcClipped.MoveToXY( *destPoint );
01232 
01233         // Check to see if this is off the destination entirely
01234         CRect off( srcClipped );
01235         if ( ! off.IntersectRect( srcClipped, destRect ) )
01236         {
01237                 srcRect->SetRect( 0, 0, 0, 0 );
01238                 return;
01239         }
01240 
01241         // Compare each side of the rectangle with the destination
01242         // rectangle... push and pull the rectangle (adjusting the destination 
01243         // point if needed) to get it completely in bounds
01244         
01245         // Offset due to destination clipping
01246         CPoint dOffset( 0, 0 );
01247 
01248         if ( srcClipped.top < destRect.top )
01249         {
01250                 dOffset.y += destRect.top - srcClipped.top;
01251                 srcClipped.top = destRect.top;
01252         }
01253         if ( srcClipped.bottom > destRect.bottom )
01254         {
01255                 srcClipped.bottom = destRect.bottom;
01256         }
01257         if ( srcClipped.left < destRect.left )
01258         {
01259                 dOffset.x += destRect.left - srcClipped.left;
01260                 srcClipped.left = destRect.left;
01261         }
01262         if ( srcClipped.right > destRect.right )
01263         {
01264                 srcClipped.right = destRect.right;
01265         }
01266 
01267         // Move the clipping source back to original place
01268         srcClipped.MoveToXY( origLoc );
01269 
01270         // Offset the rectangle by the new destination offset
01271         srcClipped.OffsetRect( dOffset );
01272 
01273         // Set the rect
01274         *srcRect = srcClipped;
01275         
01276         // The destination point is adjusted by the amount
01277         // of clipped source and by the amount of clipped destination
01278         *destPoint += -sOffset + dOffset;
01279 
01280 }//end ClipRect
01281 
01282 
01283 
01284 
01285 //Copy a Sprite onto this Sprite
01286 HRESULT CSurface::Copy( const CSurface *src, const CPoint &destPoint, const CRect &srcRect, const optional<unsigned char> alpha, const bool clip )
01287 {
01288         if ( !src || !m_pdds || !src->m_pdds )
01289         {
01290                 return DDERR_SURFACELOST;
01291         }
01292 
01293         // Clip properly
01294         CPoint destpnt( destPoint );
01295         CRect sr( srcRect );
01296 
01297         // Clip?
01298         if ( clip )
01299         {
01300                 Clip( 
01301                         CRect( 0, 0, GetWidth(), GetHeight() )  // Dest rect
01302                         , &destpnt                                                      // dest point
01303                         , CPoint( src->GetWidth(), src->GetHeight() ) // source size
01304                         , &sr                                                           // source rect
01305                         );
01306                 
01307                 // Falls outside, then nothing to do
01308                 if ( sr.IsRectNull() )
01309                         return false;
01310         }
01311 
01312         // Draw
01313         HRESULT hr = DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING;
01314         DWORD dwFlags( src->IsColorKeyed() ? DDBLTFAST_SRCCOLORKEY : 0 );
01315                 
01316         if( NULL == m_pdds )
01317         return E_POINTER;
01318 
01319         while ( hr == DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING )
01320         {
01321                 if ( alpha.valid() && (*alpha) != ALPHA_LEVEL_OPAQUE)
01322                 {
01323                         hr = CopyAlpha( GetDDrawSurface(), src->GetDDrawSurface(), *alpha, &destpnt, &sr, (src->IsColorKeyed()==1) );
01324                 }
01325                 else
01326             hr = m_pdds->BltFast( destpnt.x, destpnt.y, src->m_pdds, sr, dwFlags );
01327 
01328                 if ( FAILED( hr ) )
01329                 {
01330                         //DDAssert( hr );
01331                         return hr;
01332                 }
01333         }
01334 
01335         
01336         return hr;      
01337 }//Draw
01338 
01339 
01340 
01341 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01342 // Name: DDAssert()
01343 // Desc: This function is called if any DDraw function fails
01344 //This switch statement in this function should be updated as needed
01345 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01346 
01347 
01348 _TCHAR *TraceErrorDD(HRESULT hErr) 
01349 {        
01350         _TCHAR *c = NULL;
01351         
01352     switch (hErr) 
01353     { 
01354         case DDERR_ALREADYINITIALIZED : c = _T("DDERR_ALREADYINITIALIZED"); break; 
01355         case DDERR_CANNOTATTACHSURFACE : c = _T("DDERR_CANNOTATTACHSURFACE"); break; 
01356         case DDERR_CANNOTDETACHSURFACE : c = _T("DDERR_CANNOTDETACHSURFACE"); break; 
01357         case DDERR_CURRENTLYNOTAVAIL : c = _T("DDERR_CURRENTLYNOTAVAIL"); break; 
01358         case DDERR_EXCEPTION : c = _T("DDERR_EXCEPTION"); break; 
01359         case DDERR_GENERIC : c = _T("DDERR_GENERIC"); break; 
01360         case DDERR_HEIGHTALIGN : c = _T("DDERR_HEIGHTALIGN"); break; 
01361         case DDERR_INCOMPATIBLEPRIMARY : c = _T("DDERR_INCOMPATIBLEPRIMARY"); break; 
01362         case DDERR_INVALIDCAPS : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDCAPS"); break; 
01363         case DDERR_INVALIDCLIPLIST : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDCLIPLIST"); break; 
01364         case DDERR_INVALIDMODE : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDMODE"); break; 
01365         case DDERR_INVALIDOBJECT : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDOBJECT"); break; 
01366         case DDERR_INVALIDPARAMS : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDPARAMS"); break; 
01367         case DDERR_INVALIDPIXELFORMAT : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDPIXELFORMAT"); break; 
01368         case DDERR_INVALIDRECT : c = _T("DDERR_INVALIDRECT"); break; 
01369         case DDERR_LOCKEDSURFACES : c = _T("DDERR_LOCKEDSURFACES"); break;

01461 
01462 void DDAssert(HRESULT hRet, LPCTSTR Message)
01463 {
01464         if(hRet == DD_OK)
01465                 return;
01466 
01467 #ifdef _DEBUG
01468 //      if ( m_isFullscreen && m_pDD != NULL )
01469 //              m_pDD->FlipToGDISurface();
01470 
01471         TCHAR *ErrorDesc = TraceErrorDD(hRet);
01472 
01473         _TCHAR temp[ 128 ];
01474         _tcssprintf( temp, _T("%s (Error #%0x)"), ErrorDesc, hRet );
01475 
01476     MessageBox(NULL, Message, ErrorDesc, MB_OK);
01477 
01478         assert( 0 && "Choose Retry and Trace the Call Stack to find the offending line of code");
01479 #endif //_DEBUG
01480 
01481 }//end DDAssert
